title: Drilling Oats and Medium Red Clover

subtasks: Driving a tractor
Attaching a hay bale processor to the tractor
Navigating the tractor along the rows of hay
Operating the hay bale processor to process hay bales
Transporting processed hay bales to the storage
Operating a combine harvester
Guiding the combine harvester through the hay field
Loading the hay into the combine harvester
Dumping the cut hay onto a wagon or trailer
Guiding a wagon or trailer to the location of the processed hay
Securing the hay onto the wagon or trailer
Attaching the wagon or trailer to a vehicle
Driving the vehicle with the hay to the storage location

tasks.task: Unloading hay at the storage location
subtasks: Decoupling the wagon or trailer from the vehicle
Guiding the wagon or trailer into the storage area
Unloading the hay from the wagon or trailer into the storage

Unloading the hay at the storage location
Guiding the vehicle to the location of the processed hay
Securing the hay on the vehicle
Attaching the vehicle to the wagon or trailer
Driving the vehicle with hay to the storage

tasks.task: Loading hay onto a vehicle. The steps would be: guiding the vehicle to the hay, securing the hay, attaching to the vehicle, driving off.

tasks.task: Unloading hay at the storage location, with related subtasks. So overall:
Slining hay bales → driving tractor, attaching processor, dealing with bales, transport.
Cutting hay → operating combine, guiding, loading, and dumping.

Assuming that "Operations" here refer to day-to-day farm tasks, the operator (working with their body) would perform the tractor work, guidance, operating machines, loading hay, and transporting/storage. Hmm. Since these tasks can be detailed, hence four MAINTASKs.
